paper_title.en: Zero-cross Switch Control with High Precision over Wide Operating Range

description.en: An adaptive delta-sigma modulator which can be utilized for the zero-cross switching control of resistive heaters with AC line for thermal control is proposed. By adjusting the horizon width for the cost function of the modulator control scheme according to the command signal, the modulator has both a good performance of quantum noise suppression and a wide operating range simultaneously. A numerical example is shown to demonstrate that the proposed adaptive scheme works well.

paper_title.ja: Process identification with flexible GARX model
paper_title.en: Process identification with flexible GARX model
Self-sensing control of AC-servo motor with DSP oriented observer

description.en: A new type observer for a motion control system is developed and applied to the self-sensing control of an AC-servo motor by estimating the rotor position with the observer The proposed observer does not need any dividing operation by using the structure similar to the quasi-sliding made observer; and is suitable to the DSP applications. Furthermore, since it uses the projection scheme to estimate the estimation error it has a high flexibility for the selection of the measured variables.

publication_name.en: 6TH INTERNATIONAL WORKSHOP ON ADVANCED MOTION CONTROL, PROCEEDINGS

paper_title.en: Identification with flexible generalized ARX model

description.en: This work proposes a new type model for the system identification which is transferable to the continuous time ARX model. With this model, an accurate continuous time model can be identified reliably with some discrete time signals. The effectiveness of the proposed model is studied with an experiment with a thermal pilot plant.

publication_name.en: 14th World Congress of International Federation of Automatic Control

paper_title.en: Multivariable two-value discrete-time controller restraining load fluctuation

description.en: A multivariable discrete-time controller whose manipulated variables take two values, i.e., on and off, is proposed and examined. One of the applications of such a controller is the temperature control of a resistive electric furnace driven by AC voltage with zero-cross switching. The proposed controller is superior to one using the cycle-count method with respect to control performance. However the problem of consuming power fluctuation arises when the control system has multiple variables, as is the case when a furnace has several heaters. One approach to this problem is the use of an ordinal controller with continuous-value manip ulated variables and a Delta-Sigma modulator which converts some continuous-value signals to two-value ones, thus preserving the lower frequency behavior of the signals considering the total-load fluctuation. This approach is examined in an experimental pilot plant. It is shown that the effectiveness for load restraint is excellent, but that a trade-off appears between load restraint and control performance.
